Comment: Jointly with the Committee on Environmental Protection

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to developing a watershed protection plan for the watershed/sewershed of Jamaica Bay.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Developing a watershed protection plan for the watershed/sewershed of Jamaica Bay.

Items.Title: A Local Law to create a temporary task force to study the feasibility of transferring city-owned wetlands to the jurisdiction of the department of parks and recreation.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Create a temporary task force to study the feasibility of transferring city-owned wetlands to the jurisdiction of the department of parks and recreation.

Items.Title: Resolution strongly urging the New York State Department of Environmental Conservation to immediately develop and implement a total maximum daily load for nitrogen pollution into Jamaica Bay in order to preserve and protect this New York City jewel possessing exceptional ecological diversity.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Develop and implement a total maximum daily load for nitrogen pollution into Jamaica Bay.

Items.Title: Jointly with the Committee on Environmental Protection

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: Gennaro, DeBlasio, Jennings, Koppell, Recchia and Vallone.
